name: Arsenal Sanity Shield
tagline: Hide the football internet after a bad result
description:
Losing hurts. What makes it worse is immediately seeing headlines, hot takes, and YouTube thumbnails with crying faces. Arsenal Sanity Shield makes that stop.

The extension runs quietly in the background. When Arsenal lose or draw, it detects the result and silently hides football content across the web — articles, YouTube channels, social posts. It never tells you the score. You just browse normally and the bad news isn't there.

The free tier tracks Arsenal in the Premier League and Champions League. A premium version (Football Sanity Shield) is in development for any English club across six competitions.

changes.text: Initial release — tracks Arsenal in Premier League and Champions League
Content blocking across all sites when Arsenal lose or draw — silently, no result shown
YouTube channel blocking by channel ID and handle (AFTV, Rory Talks Arsenal, and more)
60+ Arsenal keyword list covering players, hashtags, and club names
Animated loading spinner while extension checks scores
Auto-refresh via Chrome storage listener — popup updates without close/reopen
Upsell card in popup for Football Sanity Shield premium tier
Migrated to Vercel backend API — API key is now server-side only, never shipped in extension code
Popup freezing on open during background polls
"Knocked out" badge revealing bad news — eliminated competitions now silently hidden

demos.title: Extension Popup — States
demos.description: The three popup states: Tracking (safe to browse), Polling (checking scores), and Issue (API error). The extension never shows you the actual result.
